title: phrutis
author: phrutis
content: Find the WIF challengeThe known part of the key is 40 characters from 52The address 1PfNh5fRcE9JKDmicD2Rh3pexGwce1LqyUHow to participate in the challenge:If you have a GPUs:RTX 2070, 2080, 2090, 3060, 3070, 3080, 3090, A5000, A6000 and are ready to search for a key 24/7Challenge is a collective search for a keyA large range of 12 characters is divided into 3364 small ranges.The program is configured correctly, it takes into account many technical aspects of searching for the initial part of the key.read more : https://github.com/phrutis/wif500

comments.author: stanner.austin
comments.body: @phrutisHelloYou can write here key in text wif, add ? or * at missing location.Wanted to see if i read correct photo you posted on github or not some part is hard to understand.Also your github range check on K or L for compressed ? if you consider its compressed there are K starter and L too

comments.author: phrutis
comments.body: Quote from: stanner.austin on June 29, 2022, 10:48:14 AMread FAQ: Why didn't you post the original diary photo?

comments.author: stanner.austin
comments.body: @phrutisHelloYour exe and photo exactly searching same key you think it's that hard for any one to extract text you coded in your exe ?Code:************5bCRZhiS5sEGMpmcRZdpAhmWLRfMmutGmPHtjVobkey range you searching can be found in exe but i just wanted to be sure from you.https://pastebin.com/UvdAMSvnCan you explain what your app is doing with api ?-ebat-ty-haker-eto-pizdec-ty-samiy-umniy-zagyan-v-svoyu-vzhopu-her-tebe-idi-v-zhopu-zaglyan-v-zhopu-eshyo-raz-ctfhecksdfbgrbgerjum777

comments.author: PrivatePerson
comments.body: Bitcoins came to the address 1JNX6DgbLfa9GZiQ5XUd61mj77YGzt6frb and after 18 seconds were sent to another. Why was this address written down in a book? Writing this address and private key took more than 18 seconds.

comments.author: casinotester0001
comments.body: Quote from: PrivatePerson on July 20, 2022, 01:04:13 PMBitcoins came to the address 1JNX6DgbLfa9GZiQ5XUd61mj77YGzt6frb and after 18 seconds were sent to another. Why was this address written down in a book? Writing this address and private key took more than 18 seconds.Transaction 28/Apr/2020Someone had the diary photo 2 years ago?

comments.author: NotATether
comments.body: Big ethical question here.Suppose you do find the coins (which actually belong to @soferox) - how will you return them to him?

comments.author: casinotester0001
comments.created_time: August 12, 2022, 10:09:37 AMLast edit: August 12, 2022, 10:48:03 AM by casinotester0001
comments.body: Quote from: NotATether on August 12, 2022, 03:26:09 AMSuppose you do find the coins (which actually belong to @soferox) - how will you return them to him?In FAQ: https://github.com/phrutis/wif500"The intermediary was asked to make a challenge and if the key is found, he will receive 10%. He agreed.A program was developed and the challenge was launched."It looks like @soferox will get 10% (or a bit less, because the intermediary will get a bit too).@NotATether:Btw is @soferox the owner or the intermediary?

comments.author: bigvito19
comments.body: Quote from: soferox on December 29, 2021, 11:30:42 PMI have a question. Recently there was a flood and a notebook containing a offline wallet was damage and it destroyed part of a WIF private key, so now I basically have:Kw**********(I have the next 40 characters, just not posting for obvious reasons), so I am missing 10 characters in all.I also have the public key. Is it possible to use this software to start a search at Kw... and iterate over the missing 10 characters with the known 40 characters also in the key.For example : 1B2Q8vPm5E5b8yxaNWUW5ZfdCR5Zu1KMJn - is the public addressand for the WIF private key I'd have Kw**********jcQmKRPNTF8CU9H1thzC981DCrZgmS4m8ygXFCEk (this is just an example, no funds are here)basically I want to always have search for private key start at 'Kw', then search for missing 10, and end with 'jcQmKRPNTF8CU9H1thzC981DCrZgmS4m8ygXFCEk'Any advice is appreciated and examples are even more appreciated. I do have a programming background, but I don't have much experience programming to use GPUs, which I imagine I am going to need, so I am open to any and all suggestions, other than just giving the key over to someone. I will offer a reward to anyone who successfully helps me with this too.Or is 10 characters just too many possible combos. All advice is much appreciated!Thank you,S.1PfNh5fRcE9JKDmicD2Rh3pexGwce1LqyUHe said he had a pubic key, so he must have the public key but its not a outgoing transaction for this address 1PfNh5fRcE9JKDmicD2Rh3pexGwce1LqyU

comments.author: NotATether
comments.body: Quote from: casinotester0001 on August 12, 2022, 10:09:37 AM@NotATether:Btw is @soferox the owner or the intermediary?Can you explain what you mean by intermediary?

comments.author: casinotester0001
comments.created_time: August 12, 2022, 04:48:41 PMLast edit: August 12, 2022, 05:04:23 PM by casinotester0001
comments.body: Quote from: NotATether on August 12, 2022, 11:33:07 AMQuote from: casinotester0001 on August 12, 2022, 10:09:37 AM@NotATether:Btw is @soferox the owner or the intermediary?Can you explain what you mean by intermediary?Someone who got the "diary picture" from the owner of the picture ( = owner of the coins, who also made the picture says the FAQ) and asked the organizer of the challenge to get the WIF as they have not the knowledge to compute the remaining part.Quote from: NotATether on August 12, 2022, 03:26:09 AM...which actually belong to @soferoxHow do you know, that soferox is the owner?

comments.author: seoincorporation
comments.body: Op is using this giveaway to make users install a trojan... I got this result from VirusTotal.https://www.virustotal.com/gui/file/49b0ebf707f4a1fae85cfdbc83f9b4e37592e1a162420acf1933bdfc7915046c/detectionLet's hope no one fall in this trap!And i would recommend to all users to verify each .exe before installing it, it's a good security practice that we all should follow.

comments.author: phrutis
comments.created_time: August 12, 2022, 06:40:45 PMLast edit: August 12, 2022, 06:57:32 PM by phrutis
comments.body: Quote from: seoincorporation on August 12, 2022, 06:33:06 PMOp is using this giveaway to make users install a trojan... I got this result from VirusTotal.Maybe VirusTotal isn't able to analize files good enough?Read the FAQ:Does the program require an internet connection?No, the program is looking for the key offline.Most participants run it on offline machines or rent GPUs.

comments.author: NotATether
comments.body: Quote from: casinotester0001 on August 12, 2022, 04:48:41 PMSomeone who got the "diary picture" from the owner of the picture ( = owner of the coins, who also made the picture says the FAQ) and asked the organizer of the challenge to get the WIF as they have not the knowledge to compute the remaining part.Quote from: NotATether on August 12, 2022, 03:26:09 AM...which actually belong to @soferoxHow do you know, that soferox is the owner?Well for starters, he wrote that his notebook with Bitcoin private key was damaged by a flood, and since I never saw him talk about any challenge like this, I'd say it's not likely for him to be the challenge organizer (unless he explicitly mentioned that in some post that has eluded my attention).

comments.author: pooya87
comments.body: Quote from: seoincorporation on August 12, 2022, 06:33:06 PMAnd i would recommend to all users to verify each .exe before installing it, it's a good security practice that we all should follow.Users should never even download a .exe file from a source they don't know or fully trust. Verifying is not going to give you the required information specially using unreliable tools like VirusTotal with false positives and false negatives.Specially if the project itself is closed source.

comments.author: casinotester0001
comments.body: Quote from: NotATether on August 13, 2022, 03:55:17 AMQuote from: casinotester0001 on August 12, 2022, 04:48:41 PMQuote from: NotATether on August 12, 2022, 03:26:09 AM...which actually belong to @soferoxHow do you know, that soferox is the owner?Well for starters, he wrote that his notebook with Bitcoin private key was damaged by a flood, and since I never saw him talk about any challenge like this, I'd say it's not likely for him to be the challenge organizer (unless he explicitly mentioned that in some post that has eluded my attention).The organizer of the challenge is showing a picture of the damaged paper https://github.com/phrutis/wif500. How is it possible that they have a picture, if soferox is the owner and didn't ask the organizer to create a challenge?@soferoxCan you give us an answer?

comments.author: ABCbits
comments.body: Quote from: seoincorporation on August 12, 2022, 06:33:06 PMOp is using this giveaway to make users install a trojan... I got this result from VirusTotal.https://www.virustotal.com/gui/file/49b0ebf707f4a1fae85cfdbc83f9b4e37592e1a162420acf1933bdfc7915046c/detection1 out of 70 is really weak proof though. Even Electrum 4.3.0 Windows installer has 1/65 flag[1]. The actual concern of this project are,1. Whether the author will give the reward if someone beat the challenge.2. Whether valid WIF (leads to non-empty Bitcoin address) actually exist.3. It's closed source.It all comes down to whether you trust them or not. But personally i would use my money/resource for something else even if i own or rent high end GPU.[1] https://www.virustotal.com/gui/file/8dff4ac0b8cf04226d9a67c695d7905c4c6c2400cc331e8883adea828cea0024

comments.author: casinotester0001
comments.body: Quote from: ETFbitcoin on August 13, 2022, 12:16:20 PMThe actual concern of this project are,1. Whether the author will give the reward if someone beat the challenge.2. Whether valid WIF (leads to non-empty Bitcoin address) actually exist.Soon we will know. The diagram https://github.com/phrutis/wif500 shows that they have completed 90% of the challenge.
